SEARCH

Class AbstractShape

java.lang.Object
AbstractShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Shape>, Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circle, Rectangle, Triangle
public abstract class AbstractShape extends Object implements Shape
The AbstractShape class provides a partial implementation of the Shape interface, including a reference point and the compareTo method for comparing shapes based on their areas. Subclasses of AbstractShape must implement the area() and perimeter() methods to calculate the area and perimeter of the shape, respectively.

    • AbstractShape

      protected AbstractShape()
      Constructs an AbstractShape object with no specified reference point. This constructor is intended for subclasses to set the reference point later.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Shape other)
      Compares this shape with another shape based on their areas.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Shape>
      Parameters:
      other - the other shape to compare to.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this shape is less than, equal to, or greater than the other shape in terms of area.
